questions.question: What is the ALPHA Lab at NIE?
questions.answer: The ALPHA Lab (Artificial Learning Platform for Higher Aspirations) at NIE is a dedicated research and innovation center for AI and ML. It also functions as the ALPHA Innovation & Tinkerers' Lab, focusing on fostering student innovation, hands-on learning, and interdisciplinary projects. It provides high-end GPU servers, access to advanced AI/ML tools and datasets, and industry mentorship for UG, PG, and research scholars working on hands-on projects, startups, and industry collaborations.

questions.question: What scholarships are available at NIE?
questions.answer: NIE students are eligible for a wide range of scholarships and financial aid every year, including state, central, and private schemes. Examples include AICTE Pragati, SSP Post Matric, Reliance Foundation, FFE, SKF Girls Scholarship, Vidyasiri, Raitha Vidyanidhi, Women in Engineering, and more. Eligibility, deadlines, and required documents vary by scheme. Detailed circulars, forms, and application links are published on the official Scholarship Section of the NIE website. Please check there regularly for updates.

questions.question: Is there ragging at NIE?
questions.answer: NIE has zero tolerance for ragging. There have been no major ragging incidents in recent years, and any reported cases are acted on immediately. The campus and hostels are monitored 24/7 by wardens, and student mentoring is provided. Students can report anonymously, and official anti-ragging contacts are available on the NIE Anti-Ragging portal.
